acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court papers from Stafford County, (Va.)

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Stafford County was formed in 1664 from Westmoreland County.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Deed Books (Libers O, P and S), 1748-1767 and 1780-1786, of Stafford County Court. The deed books record the name of the grantor and grantee, the residence of both individuals and the description of property being sold or transferred. The volumes also includes wills. Deed Book Liber O does not contain any deeds, but it does contain wills. The will book includes the name of testator, list of heirs and the year the wills were proven in court and probate records such as inventories and appraisements. The only deeds that are legible in Deed Book Liber P are (1754-1761). The volumes have indexes which contains the first and last names of both parties. It is arranged alphabetically from A-Z.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Stafford County Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm.

Stafford County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional Stafford County Court Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localities Database found at the Library of Virginia web site.
